data.title: China's tech giants move AI model training overseas to access Nvidia chips, FT reports
data.description: Alibaba and ByteDance are among the tech firms training their newest large language models in Southeast Asian data centres, the report ⁠said, citing ‌two people with direct knowledge of the matter.  Chinese companies rely on lease agreements for overseas ‌data centres owned and operated by non-Chinese entities, the newspaper said, noting that DeepSeek, which gathered a large stock of Nvidia chips before the US export bans, was an exception ⁠with its model being trained domestically.
